item.title: Polymetal Agrees to Sell Russian Assets
item.description: Polymetal said it was selling its Russian business for $3.7 billion and intended to refocus its operations in Kazakhstan.

item.title: Cost of Insuring European Junk Bonds Against Default Rises
item.description: The cost of insuring European junk bonds against default climbed on rising uncertainty about the path of central banks’ rate decisions after last week’s stronger-than-expected economic data.

item.title: Israel Sets Deadline for Rafah Ground Offensive Within Weeks
item.description: Israel provided its first timeline for looming operations in the southern Gaza city that have become a source of tension with the U.S.

item.title: In Russia's Far-Flung Cities, Navalny Inspired Average People to Challenge Putin
item.description: Alexei Navalny taught a generation of young activists to push for change, starting at the local level. That movement has steadily been extinguished.

item.title: Self-Driving Cars Might Just Transform the Way We Work
item.description: BMW, Audi, Volvo and others are coming up with ideas for making the car function as your office when you no longer have to drive it.

item.title: Tiger Woods Offers a Glimpse of What's Next
item.description: The 15-time major winner’s latest, abbreviated comeback showcased his limitations—and offered a flash of the old magic that still remains.

item.title: Stock Futures Rise Ahead of Busy Earnings Week
item.description: Bellwether companies including Nvidia, Walmart and Home Depot are due to report results.

item.title: Watch: Why Immigration Legislation Is Next to Impossible to Pass in Congress
FTSE 100 Trades Flat in Absence of Market-Moving Data
item.description: The FTSE 100 traded flat in the absence of big corporate or economic data releases, but the sluggish start is expected to change “later in the week when the minutes of the latest Fed meeting are released and the AI stock Nvidia unveils its latest quarterly results”, AJ Bell said.

item.title: Amplats Plans Job Cuts as Profits Tumble
item.description: Anglo American Platinum said it could cut around 3,700 jobs in a restructuring as it grapples with lower prices, rising costs and an uncertain outlook.

item.title: Ozempic Is Taking Off With the World's Largest Obese Population
item.description: A growing gray market for the weight-loss treatment is posing a regulatory conundrum in a country with a serious obesity problem. (Hint: It isn’t the U.S.)

item.title: America's Oil Power Might Be Near Its Peak
item.description: Gushers of new U.S. crude have helped cap soaring oil prices despite OPEC production cuts and global turmoil, but that growth is expected to slow dramatically this year.

item.title: The Boom in Battery Metals for EVs Is Turning to Bust
item.description: Producers of lithium and nickel have paused projects after prices collapse and momentum slows for electric-vehicle sales.

item.title: Lauren Boebert Tries to Convince New District She's Not All Drama
item.description: Rep. Lauren Boebert of Colorado is running for election in another congressional district, where analysts expect a hard-fought and unpredictable GOP primary race.

item.title: Billions Start Flowing to Chip Makers for New U.S. Factories
item.description: The Biden administration is pledging $1.5 billion in grants to GlobalFoundries in the first major award to revitalize the domestic semiconductor industry.

item.title: SoftBank's $118 Billion Arm Problem
item.description: The Japanese firm may have limited time to solve the challenge presented by its stake in the thriving British chip designer.

item.title: The President at the Center of an Odd Biden-Trump Debate: Herbert Hoover
item.description: Donald Trump says he doesn’t want to be Herbert Hoover, the president who took office months before the Great Depression began in 1929. President Biden says his predecessor and GOP rival already is.

item.title: EUR/USD Seen In Narrow Range Near Term
item.description: The euro was flat against the dollar and it was likely to remain in a narrow range near term, ING said.

item.title: Metal Prices Mixed as Risk-off Sentiment Weighs on Industrial Metals
item.description: Base metals were weaker but gold firmer with U.S. markets closed and as eyes turned to China for hints over demand expectations, as the country returns to work after the Lunar New Year.

item.title: Oil Falls Amid Concerns Over Slowing Demand
item.description: Oil prices were lower in Europe on market concerns over sluggish demand and as hopes for imminent Fed interest-rate cuts fade.
